posts.post_content:
I too can't see why this isn't more popular- exiling a combo piece for two mana? Sounds good to me.  
  
Compare [Distress](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Distress)- for the trouble of that white mana, Castigate stops [Darksteel Colossus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Darksteel Colossus), [Progenitus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Progenitus) and the legendary Eldrazi from auto-recurring.

Posted By: True_Mumin (7/12/2009 6:03:20 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
People seem to overlook the fact that not only does Castigate forces your opponent to REVEAL his/her hand, it also REMOVES the card from the game instead of just discarding it. That means the card of your choice gets no recur, no madness, no shuffle back into library. In addition to all that, you can plan according to their revealed hand.  
  
Gerrard's Verdict is a powerful card as well but your opponent chooses which two to discard and they still has the chance to be retrieved later. Also, you cannot look at their hand.  
  
I don't see how people would consider GV to be strictly better than Castigate.
posts.html:
People seem to overlook the fact that not only does Castigate forces your opponent to REVEAL his/her hand, it also REMOVES the card from the game instead of just discarding it. That means the card of your choice gets no recur, no madness, no shuffle back into library. In addition to all that, you can plan according to their revealed hand.

Gerrard's Verdict is a powerful card as well but your opponent chooses which two to discard and they still has the chance to be retrieved later. Also, you cannot look at their hand.

I don't see how people would consider GV to be strictly better than Castigate.

Opponent: \*pokerface\*

Opponent: o\_\_\_\_\_\_o

Posted By: A_Real_Travesty (9/23/2012 10:30:03 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I used to run four of these in my Orzhov discard, then swapped them out for [Tidehollow Sculler](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Tidehollow Sculler). Then they reprinted [Duress](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Duress), which is unfortunately no longer as good as it used to be (with Flashback still in circulation and important creature threats like [Snapcaster Mage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Snapcaster Mage) and [Delver of Secrets](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Delver of Secrets). So I put [Castigate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Castigate ) back in, replacing Duress.
posts.html:
I used to run four of these in my Orzhov discard, then swapped them out for Tidehollow Sculler. Then they reprinted Duress, which is unfortunately no longer as good as it used to be (with Flashback still in circulation and important creature threats like Snapcaster Mage and Delver of Secrets. So I put Castigate back in, replacing Duress.
